intro: Corydalis pauciflora var. latiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaved corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be challenging to grow outside its natural range.
